page.title: 09LAW AND ORDER - ROAD SAFETY
page.content: ROAD SAFETY: COMING TO ST.PAUL'S SCHOOL IS DANGEROUS. 2 BOYS WERE INJURED THIS TERM AND SENT TO HOSPITAL WE HAVE 2 CROSSING PATROLS WHO STOP TRAFFIC BY DISPLAYING DISC SHAPED STOP SIGNS AND CONDUCT US OVER ROADS.WE ALSO USE ZEBRA CROSSINGS(i.e.LANES PAINTED ON THE ROAD WITH WHITE STRIPES)AND BEACON LIGHTS. CARS MUST STOP BY LAW TO LET US CROSS. AT THE LEISURE CENTRE IS A PELICON CROSSING WHERE WE OPERATE RED & GREEN LIGHT SIGNALS FOR TRAFFIC TO STOP AND LET US CROSS OVER. WE CANNOT CYCLE TO SCHOOL UNTIL WE PASS A POLICE CYCLING PROFICIENCY TEST TAKEN AT SCHOOL (SCHOOL RULE) NO CARS ARE ALLOWED TO PARK OUTSIDE SCHOOL TO KEEP A CLEAR VIEW AND THERE ARE GUARD RAILS TO STOP US RUNNING OUT OF THE SCHOOL GATE ONTO THE ROAD.SOMETIMES WE HAVE POLICE ROAD SAFETY LECTURES AT SCHOOL.
